newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-ANZ case with Indian bank drags on.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-ANZ case with Indian bank drags on.

text.p: The Australia and New Zealand Banking Group (ANZ) Ltd said on Wednesday that the deadline for abritration of its dispute with the Indian National Housing Bank had been extended to the end of February.

"We are now awaiting the decision of the arbritrators. Several extensions have been made for the this arbitration. The last date was December 31 and both parties have agreed to extend this to the end of February," ANZ chairman Charles Goode told the annual meeting in answer to a question.
The Indian National Housing Bank has made claims against the ANZ which have been in arbitration since the beginning of 1993.

ANZ Managing Director Don Mercer said in mid-1994 that he hoped the case would be finished within six months and that he did not expect any agreement to impact on earnings per share or shareholder funds.
